intro: Gynoxys prenanthifolia, commonly known as the Mexican flameflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking red or orange tubular flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively drought-tolerant once established. Gynoxys prenanthifolia is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
